Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend two movies from this list: ' Wheelmen ' and ' Saving Grace '. 
' Wheelmen ' is a French film directed by Jean-Luc Godard in 1972. The film tells the story of two American limousine drivers, Max (James Stewart) and Bob (Richard Burgi), who have been hired to transport Vice President Nelson Rockefeller to a special session of Congress in Washington, D.C. However, their journey takes an unexpected turn when they discover that their passengers, Nelson Rockefeller and his wife, Jane Taft, have been kidnapped by the revolutionary group Revolutionary Communist Party of China (CCP) in order to use them as bargaining chips for greater political autonomy from the Chinese government.  |
' Saving Grace ' is a American film directed by Robert Wise in 1972. The film tells the story of two women who live together in Los Angeles, California, and are friends with each other's husbands. One day, one of the women, Grace (Helen Hunt), discovers that her husband has been having an affair with Grace' s best friend and Grace' s husband, David (William Hurt)). Grace is shocked by this discovery and confronts both David and his mistress, who turns out to be a police officer. The three of them then engage in a heated argument about the nature of love and relationships.  |
In summary, ' Wheelmen ' and ' Saving Grace ' are two different American films directed by Robert Wise in 1972. The first film is an action film that tells the story of two American limousine drivers, Max (James Stewart) and Bob (Richard Burgi), who have been hired to transport Vice President Nelson Rockefeller to a special session of Congress in Washington, D.C.
